H0.text: Decomposing dead organisms are the source of energy for mushrooms.

H1.text: Killing organisms is how mushrooms get their energy.

H2.text: Accumulating dead organisms is how mushrooms get their energy.

H3.text: Producing dead organisms is where mushrooms get their energy.

A4.text: Fungi perform an essential role in the decomposition of organic matter and have fundamental roles in nutrient cycling and exchange in the environment.

A5.text: Fungi are traditionally considered heterotrophs, organisms that rely solely on carbon fixed by other organisms for metabolism.
